into what happened there we've seen a number of cases in the open source Community where projects were pivoted
due to business agenda or commercial needs we saw that happen with sentos sentos was one of the primary one of the
biggest Enterprise operating systems ever people were using it all over the
place Enterprise organ organizations and professional it teams were all leveraging sentos for sentos to be
stripped away from the community and removed as a suitable option to meet their needs created a massive pain point

that this does not happen again and that is what we created with Rocky Linux and
the rsf okay you mentioned the RF what is that and what is its relationship to
Rocky Linux the RF is the rocky enterprise software foundation and it is a
organization that we created to hold ourselves responsible to what it is that
we've promised that we're going to do with the community it is community run it is community-led we have a board of
directors which uh is comprised of a number of people that have a huge amount of experience both with Linux as well as
open source and Comm community and from this organization we solidify the
governance of how we are to manage Rocky Linux and any other projects that come
and join in this Vision sounds good Greg I love it so Enterprise Linux the open

work because everything is immutable by default so for example if you think like
have you used Jupiter notebooks before I've I've loaded one like I've never written one right okay yeah so the way
the Jupiter notebooks work is that you have the cells and you can think the way they operate is that you have some code
that code gets the variables from some Global State change those variables and
put back in This Global state so everything is global State and that makes it very hard for the notebooks to
be reproducible so the example that I gave is that if I have a cell that is x equals x + 1 and X starts with zero
every time we execute that cell in a Jupiter notebook the value of x is going to increment which means that if you
want to share that notebook with somebody right you have to say hey for you to get the same result as I do you
have to go and execute the cell number three three times right so so there is
this aspect but in Elixir like in life book if you do xal + one and X plus zero
you can execute that 100 times at the end X is going to be one so we had this whole focus on making everything
reproducible there are some like PTO notebooks that try to solve that but because everything is globally State
like I cannot pend to a list that Global State you have in the Jupiter notebook and those things they are greatly
reduced in live book and because of that we're able to do a lot of very specific tooling on top of this abstraction the
